g.text: Gene Randomisation ConstructOur gene randomisation construct is designed to reduce the labour of metabolic pathway optimisation by allowing researchers to test large numbers of homologous enzyme combinations in parallel. This is achieved by introducing all the genes for a synthetic pathwayâ€™s homologues and using multiple orthogonal randomisers to express just one at each step. This means, for a 5 step pathway with 4 randomly-expressed homologues for each step, a culture designed with our toolkit would contain cells expressing all 1024 possible combinations of homologues.
